channel.title: link-log on wilspi | Sourabh
channel.description: Recent content in link-log on wilspi | Sourabh

item.description: ​ 27/07/2022 reuniting china theory sold by xi jinping to expand storytelling via music + hp - i see hp i click - rewatch read better rubber stamp president, Droupadi Murmu? 26/07/2022 Panvel’s heritage spots and legacy Saraab by Samar playing live 25/07/2022 Gary Vee’s book notes tripping on saraab by samar atlassian founders’ journey - twitter thread wrong with indian media competing for ad revenue (with youtubers, influencers) clickbait/porn-ish articles - +paid pr compromising content - selling product/idea/political bias 24/07/2022

​ 04/11/2021 Dune https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_UM3Lhj9Ywk https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yhYU4ZbLmmk 22/09/2021 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=83iZ68s-9YE Farm Laws India 2020 - Documentary https://dev.to/codesphere/should-i-use-sqlite-postgresql-or-mysql-1o4b 20/09/2021 https://moontowermeta.com/the-most-important-solutions-are-simple-just-not-easy/ https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VmbSpTJXozk we hire products to do the job for us https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eJ07g2NtOiY decomplication: the art of first principles thinking www.paulgraham.com/mean.html meanness and success are inversely correlated (PG admits there might be selection bias here) for most of history success meant control of scarce resources this is changing, increasingly the games that matter are not zero-sum being mean makes you stupid, makes you fight, and in turn drains your energy mean founders struggle with hiring best people (since best people have better options and mean founders cant convince to join them) 03/09/2021

​ 07/10/20 https://www.sidharthajha.com/blog/lky-dials-of-gov 06/10/20 https://firstmonday.org/article/view/578/499 The Cathedral and the Bazaar: Musings on Linux and Open Source by an Accidental Revolutionary (abbreviated CatB) is an essay, and later a book, by Eric S. Raymond Summary, here 28/09/20 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_DxJJKJc2Y4 “Switch chess sides” - good way to learn and understand the game from opposite perspective https://en.m.wikisource.org/wiki/Why_I_am_an_atheist%3F Essay by Bhagat Singh 27/09/20 https://github.com/tesseract-ocr/tesseract Tesseract OCR https://heartbleed.com/ Heartbleed, SSL vulnerability https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heartbleed https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fortune_(Unix)#Purpose Fortune program https://www.notion.so/UrbanNazi-com-A-Social-Media-Report-for-Bot-Detection-9aab55d505dd43a7b74c96586d071432 Bots on Twitter -> Analysis from Indian context https://dogrilyrics.
